short_description.display_value: Standard Change for ServiceNow Platform Updates
short_description.value: Standard Change for ServiceNow Platform Updates

description.display_value:
Migration from Custom Project Management application to ServiceNow Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) Module

This change implements the transition from the existing custom Project Management application (x_mobit_pm_project) to the out-of-the-box ServiceNow Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) module. The migration aims to leverage SPM's enhanced capabilities for better visibility, governance, and reporting across all projects.

Scope of Change:
- Migration of all existing project data from the custom app to SPM tables:
        x_mobit_pm_project → pm_project
        x_mobit_pm_phase → pm_project_task (with additional attributes)
        x_mobit_pm_role → sn_plng_att_core_resource_assignment (with new fields)
- Inclusion of related data: resources, time cards, project tasks, milestones, dates, and all other key attributes.
- Deployment of migration scripts over the weekend to minimize impact — ensuring all project managers see their migrated projects in SPM by Monday morning.
- Introduction of new SPM features:
- Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and Gantt chart
- Project Status Reports (exportable to PDF with internal and client templates)
- RIDAC tracking (Risks, Issues, Decisions, Actions, Changes)
- Resource and Capacity Management dashboards for workload visibility and forecasting
- Enhanced Time Sheet Portal with mandatory comments and task selector improvements
- Improved project closure process (all pending time sheets and stories must be closed)
- Enforced time-tracking restriction for projects in "On Hold" status
- Migration of Surveys to the new SPM data structure

description.display_value: A new Catalog Item has been created for on-demand group provisioning. The item retrieves all groups from Entra ID and displays them in a group selection field. When a user selects a group, the system checks if it is already part of provisioning. If the group is already provisioned, the field is cleared and a message is shown to the user. If not, upon submission of the request, the selected group is automatically added to provisioning through automation. This change streamlines the process of managing group provisioning and reduces duplication.

1. Go to the CSM portal and impersonate Christopher Legaretta. Repeat steps 2 - 8 for AllCare Update User and Return From Absence catalogs.
2. Browse the request -> HR category -> catalogs from the step 1
3. User to update: Abigail Kapadia (Admin Clerk) for ROA and Anne Pale (Regional Manager) for AllCare Update User Data.
4. Fill all mandatory fields.
5. Make sure Phone assignment option is available. Select it and submit a request.
6. The RITM for Phone assignment should be routed to the AllCare Fulfillers group for manual provisioning.
7. Close all related catalog tasks for the request.
8. Make sure request is closed complete automatically.
9. Try to select Phone assignment for Betzy Ponce for ROA ,and Amber Tucker for AllCare Update User Data. Expected result - users not able to see this option due to missing required job title.

description.display_value: The objective of this task is to automate the posting of a Slack message whenever a Customer Satisfaction Survey is completed in ServiceNow. This will be triggered upon the insertion or update of a record in the asmt_assessment_instance table, specifically when the Metric Type is set to Customer Satisfaction Survey and the State changes to Complete. Once these conditions are met, a message should be sent to the designated Slack channel (ID: C08G9Q50H1U). The Slack message must include the responses to all 14 survey questions, providing a complete snapshot of the customer's feedback for monitoring and follow-up purposes. This integration ensures timely visibility into customer sentiment and supports proactive service improvement.

description.display_value: Subscription Management Additional billing process
description.value: Subscription Management Additional billing process

justification.display_value:
Create Expense Lines for accounting cases
1. We need to add end user licenses to some customer billing sheets. For now just Altus. $3 per active user. For other companies this model should apply. We need to have property to store for which companies we include per-user bill, and for which companies it's special (like altus $3 despite of amount of users)
2. We need to generate expense lines with Task=ACC in Pending state when we generate billing to customer. BSH, Fulfiller, End user license - all generate separate expense line card. Add Company field to card. Change state of Expense lines to processed when ACC gets closed complete
3. Add related list with expense lines to ACC.

u_update_set.display_value: AK;STRY0010726;Share Agile board with Clients, AK;STRY0010726;Share Agile board with Clients -PM App

description.display_value: This change introduces a new mechanism in ServiceNow for securely sharing Agile Visual Task Boards (VTB) with external clients. A button labeled "Share Agile Board" will be added to enable project managers to initiate the sharing process. When used, the selected clients will be granted internal roles, all Agile artifacts will be moved to the client's domain, and the clients will be automatically added to the project's default Agile team. Additionally, a second button titled "Add Clients to Board" will be available for project managers to add more clients after the board has already been shared. To support external user onboarding, a new catalog item called "Agile Board Access Request" will be introduced. This allows external users to request board access, and upon approval by the project manager, the requestor will be automatically added to the Agile team. This workflow ensures smooth collaboration between internal teams and external stakeholders.
description.value: This change introduces a new mechanism in ServiceNow for securely sharing Agile Visual Task Boards (VTB) with external clients. A button labeled "Share Agile Board" will be added to enable project managers to initiate the sharing process. When used, the selected clients will be granted internal roles, all Agile artifacts will be moved to the client's domain, and the clients will be automatically added to the project's default Agile team. Additionally, a second button titled "Add Clients to Board" will be available for project managers to add more clients after the board has already been shared. To support external user onboarding, a new catalog item called "Agile Board Access Request" will be introduced. This allows external users to request board access, and upon approval by the project manager, the requestor will be automatically added to the Agile team. This workflow ensures smooth collaboration between internal teams and external stakeholders.

justification.display_value: The proposed change is essential for enabling structured and secure collaboration with external clients on Agile projects. By automating the sharing and access management process, it reduces manual administrative tasks for project managers and ensures that client users are appropriately scoped and added to the correct Agile team and domain. This promotes better transparency, accelerates delivery, and aligns with our goal of improving client engagement and project visibility without compromising governance or data separation standards.

u_update_set.display_value: SK;STRY0011022;Incident close via email reply

description.display_value: We are proposing a change to enhance the user experience by adding a "Close Case" or "Close Incident" link to all email notifications sent to the submitter of a Case or Incident. This includes notifications triggered by events such as comment added, state changes, on hold, resolution, or creation of the record. The added link will generate a pre-formatted mailto request, which, when sent, will automatically close the related Case or Incident. This functionality will be similar to the existing Approve/Reject email actions used in the platform. The following instructional text will be included in the notification: "You can close your case at any time by clicking the 'Close Case' link below and sending the auto-generated email (DO NOT MODIFY CONTENT)." This change is intended to simplify the process for end users who wish to close their records and reduce the manual effort required from support staff. A reference example of the intended email action behavior can be found in the existing Approve/Reject email implementation.

description.display_value:
Watch list for Accounting case
Automatically updated the Watch list for Accounting cases based on predefined conditions.

Issue with On Hold Modal
Fixed a bug in the "On Hold" modal where it was not displaying or functioning correctly in certain cases.

Accounting Inquiry request
Implemented functionality to handle Accounting Inquiry requests according to business requirements.

Change Request updates
Enhanced Change Request handling logic with improved validation and data display.

Accounting List on workspace
Added a dynamic list of Accounting cases to the workspace for easier access and visibility.

Copy Accounting Case
Developed functionality to copy existing Accounting cases while preserving key field values.

Rename Slack Channel Request
Created a new process to request Slack channel renames through ServiceNow with proper name validation.

justification.display_value: In the Mobiz domain across UAT/Prod environments, the magnifying glass icon used for reference field lookups is not responding within the Service Case form in Classic UI and CSM/FSM Workspace. When users open any Service Case, clicking the magnifying glass does not trigger the expected record search dialog. This issue affects all fields with a reference lookup. Screenshot evidence is attached for reference. The expected behavior is that clicking the magnifying glass should open the lookup window to search and select related records.

u_update_set.display_value: FA-STRY0010199-Time tracking for Agile 2.0, AK;STRY0010199;Time tracking for Agile 2.0, AK;STRY0011297;Prevent time card creation, AK;STRY0011314;New BR on story table

description.display_value: This change request proposes enhancements to the time tracking functionality for Stories. A new field will be added to the time card to display the project linked with the associated Story. When employees track time against a Story on the portal, the related Project should be visible. Additionally, users should not be allowed to track time on Stories that are linked to closed projects. Time card creation will be restricted under two conditions: if the Story is not associated with any Project, or if the user has no assigned role in the related Project—both scenarios will trigger appropriate error messages. Furthermore, if a Story has any approved time cards under a specific project (Project A), it must not be allowed to move to another project (Project B), in compliance with an existing business rule that prevents changes to the task on approved time card records. These changes are intended to enforce governance, ensure accurate time reporting, and prevent unauthorized or inconsistent data updates.
description.value: This change request proposes enhancements to the time tracking functionality for Stories. A new field will be added to the time card to display the project linked with the associated Story. When employees track time against a Story on the portal, the related Project should be visible. Additionally, users should not be allowed to track time on Stories that are linked to closed projects. Time card creation will be restricted under two conditions: if the Story is not associated with any Project, or if the user has no assigned role in the related Project—both scenarios will trigger appropriate error messages. Furthermore, if a Story has any approved time cards under a specific project (Project A), it must not be allowed to move to another project (Project B), in compliance with an existing business rule that prevents changes to the task on approved time card records. These changes are intended to enforce governance, ensure accurate time reporting, and prevent unauthorized or inconsistent data updates.
